entries.title: Investors Should Consider Being Neutral U.S. Treasurys on Risky Political Outlook
entries.description: Investors should consider turning neutral on U.S. Treasurys rather than staying overweight given the riskier political outlook in 2H 2024, Bank of Singapore said.

entries.title: U.K. Retail Sales Rebounded Weakly in May
entries.description: Retail sales ticked higher in the U.K. last month, recovering some previous decline ahead of general elections slated for July, according to a BRC-KPMG report.

entries.title: Hitachi, Microsoft Plan for Multibillion-Dollar AI Partnership
entries.description: Hitachi and Microsoft announced a multibillion-dollar collaboration to accelerate the adoption of generative artificial intelligence, the latest in a series of partnerships and investments the two companies are undertaking.

entries.title: Why China's Overcapacity Problem Is About to Get Even Worse, in Seven Charts
entries.description: Cheap Chinese high-tech goods have flooded the global economy this year, raising alarms in Washington and Brussels.

entries.title: Big Tech Companies Unplug Stock Market From Reality
entries.description: The big-vs.-small-stocks phenomenon reflects the same disconnects we see in the broader economy.

entries.title: Inside the Ukrainian Lab Exposing U.S. Chips in Russia's Weapons
entries.description: Despite Western sanctions, Russia still gets foreign-made components for arms used against Ukraine. WSJ’s Ian Lovett reports from inside the forensic lab exposing Moscow’s access to vital microchips.

entries.title: India's Narendra Modi Projected to Win Historic Third Term
entries.description: Exit polls predict he will become only the second leader in India’s history to win three straight terms.

entries.title: A woman sued prominent psychiatrist Henry Jarecki, accusing him of participating in the late Jeffrey Epstein's sex-trafficking operation.
entries.description: A woman sued prominent psychiatrist Henry Jarecki, accusing him of participating in the late Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking operation.

entries.title: Claudia Sheinbaum won a landslide victory to become Mexico's first female president and the nation's first Jewish head of state, in an election that paved the way for constitutional changes that risk weakening the country's democracy.
entries.description: Claudia Sheinbaum won a landslide victory to become Mexico’s first female president and the nation’s first Jewish head of state, in an election that paved the way for constitutional changes that risk weakening the country’s democracy.

entries.title: New York plans to prohibit social-media companies from using algorithms to steer content to children without parental consent under a tentative agreement reached by state lawmakers, people familiar with the matter said.
entries.description: New York plans to prohibit social-media companies from using algorithms to steer content to children without parental consent under a tentative agreement reached by state lawmakers, people familiar with the matter said.

entries.title: Dr. Anthony Fauci defended the federal government's leadership during the Covid-19 pandemic in a congressional hearing and said he didn't influence research into Covid's origins.
entries.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci defended the federal government’s leadership during the Covid-19 pandemic in a congressional hearing and said he didn’t influence research into Covid’s origins.

entries.title: Netanyahu showed cautious support for an initiative by Biden to end the war in Gaza, saying he was open to a temporary cease-fire to release hostages but wanted a free hand to resume fighting Hamas.
entries.description: Netanyahu showed cautious support for an initiative by Biden to end the war in Gaza, saying he was open to a temporary cease-fire to release hostages but wanted a free hand to resume fighting Hamas.

entries.title: Biden was expected to sign an executive order banning migrants who cross the southern border illegally from claiming asylum, an effort meant to quell voter discontent with his handling of immigration ahead of the presidential election.
entries.description: Biden was expected to sign an executive order banning migrants who cross the southern border illegally from claiming asylum, an effort meant to quell voter discontent with his handling of immigration ahead of the presidential election.

entries.title: China accused British intelligence of recruiting a Chinese couple as well-placed spies in key state agencies, amid a simmering fight with the West over espionage.
entries.description: China accused British intelligence of recruiting a Chinese couple as well-placed spies in key state agencies, amid a simmering fight with the West over espionage.

entries.title: What's News: World-Wide
entries.description: What’s News: World-Wide

entries.title: Biden's Cease-Fire Plan Seeks to Push Hamas and Israel Into an Agreement Neither Wants
entries.description: The U.S. president is more interested in a deal than the two warring parties.

entries.title: Spotify raised its prices for the second time this year as the music-streaming service aims to become more consistently profitable, sending shares higher.
entries.description: Spotify raised its prices for the second time this year as the music-streaming service aims to become more consistently profitable, sending shares higher.

entries.title: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers surged after some reported record sales in May, spurring hopes that more price cuts are imminent as companies race to grow market share.
entries.description: Shares of Chinese electric-vehicle makers surged after some reported record sales in May, spurring hopes that more price cuts are imminent as companies race to grow market share.

entries.title: Maersk again raised its full-year guidance as disruptions in the Red Sea and strong shipping demand continue to buoy global freight rates.
entries.description: Maersk again raised its full-year guidance as disruptions in the Red Sea and strong shipping demand continue to buoy global freight rates.

entries.title: Medical-technology company Becton Dickinson agreed to acquire Edwards Lifesciences' Critical Care product group for $4.2 billion, increasing its access to hospital customers.
entries.description: Medical-technology company Becton Dickinson agreed to acquire Edwards Lifesciences’ Critical Care product group for $4.2 billion, increasing its access to hospital customers.
